newsitem.title: USA: US Republican tax plan has no corp. cap gains cut.
newsitem.headline: US Republican tax plan has no corp. cap gains cut.

text.p: A united House-Senate Republican tax plan being used as the basis for negotiation with the White House does not include a reduction in the corporate capital gains tax rate, a congressional aide said Wednesday.
The House tax cut bill had included a reduction in the corporate capital gains rate to 30 percent from 35 percent.
A decision had not yet been reached on whether or not to extend the ethanol subsidy after it expires at the end of 2000, Sen. Charles Grassley, an Iowa Republican, said.
